decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers: Location Plan, Block Plan P-101 V3, Existing Plans P-102, Existing Elevations P-103, Proposed Plans P-104 V2, Proposed Elevations P-105 V2.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) policies 7.4 and 7B; London Plan (2021) policy D3 and National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | No part of the roof of the rear extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 2.1 of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D6 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | Refuse and recycling storage in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority, shall be implemented and made available prior to the first occupation of any part of the development and retained in perpetuity.

Reason:  To ensure that suitable and accessible refuse storage facilities are provided and in the interests of the visual and general amenities of the area, in accordance with policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and policy SI 7 of the London Plan (2021). | The cycle storage facility shown on the approved plans shall provide 4 cycle parking spaces stored horizontally in accordance with London Cycling Design Standards and these spaces shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the adequate bicycle storage provision and in the interests of reducing congestion to the local transport network, in accordance with policies 1.1 (j) and 3.1(i) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy T5 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | Control measures shall ensure that the following standards are implemented:
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays,
- notifications of works to interested parties and regular neighbour liaison,
- public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies SI1 and D14 of The London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of enhanced sound insulation values of at least 5dB above the ADE Building Regulations values, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings/areas, namely, bedroom above kitchen/ dining/ living room of separate dwelling and of at least 10dB enhancement for bedroom adjoining the communal main entrance. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2023) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | Prior to occupation of the dwellings hereby approved a timber fence 1.8m high shall be erected between the private amenity areas of the flats as indicated on approved plan and this fence shall be permanently retained.

Reason: To protect the residential amenity of residents of the flats and ensure adequate provision of private amenity space in accordance with policies 1.1 and 2.1 of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7D of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D6 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | The car parking space on the northern side of the front forecourt as shown on approved plan P104 V2 shall be allocated to proposed ground floor flat A and retained as such for the life of the development hereby approved.

Reason: To protect the residential amenity of ground floor flat A in accordance with policies 1.1 and 2.1 of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D6 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | The flats hereby approved shall be used for Class C3 residential use and for no other purpose including any other purpose in Class C4 of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended) or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification.

Reason: To protect the character of the area and amenity of nearby residents and to allow the Local Planning Authority to exert control over any proliferation of Houses in Multiple Occupation in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
description: Conversion of existing single family dwellinghouse into 2 self-contained flats with single storey rear extension and alterations to the boundary wall
